short_summary: Remove fire exposure threat from contaminated equipment in a large facility environment.
description: There is a contaminated equipment fire exposure threat in a large facility environment. This expired notice is the Phase 2 solicitation following an Invitation to Qualify. Only qualified suppliers have been invited to bid.
full_summary:
================================outdirTreuty Sector Propement notice

### General Information

* **Contract Title**: Phase 2 - DND - Nanoose TX ACM Removal - CFB Esquimalt - Nanoose Bay, BC
* **Contract Reference**: WS3753411446-Doc3792335231
* **Publication Date**: December 19, 2022
* **Closing Date**: January 16, 2023, 14:00:00

### Solicitation Details

* **Procurement Method**: Competitive - Selective Tendering
* **Selection Criteria**: Lowest Price
* **Trade Agreements**: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* **Regions of Delivery**: Canada
* **Contracting Entity**: Ministry of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **Address**: 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, QC K1A 0S5, Canada

### End User Information

* **End User Entity**: Department of National Defence (DND)
* **Address**: 101 Colonel By Dr, Ottawa, ON K1A 0K2, Canada

### Contact Information

* **Contact Person**: Brandie Klyne (SPAC/PSPC)
* **Email**: brandie.klyne@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

### Notice Details

This is the Phase 2 solicitation following an Invitation to Qualify. Only qualified suppliers have been invited to bid. The notice has been updated to reflect the closing date.

### Procurement Category

* **Procurement Category**: Capital Acquisition and Maintenance Services (CNST)
* **Notice Type**: Invitation to Qualify
* ** UNSPSC Description**:
  * Toxic and hazardous waste cleanup
  * Environmental Services

Note that the above has been succinctly rephrased, edited, and formatted according to your guidelines. Every piece of information from the original text has been included. A two-column table comparing the original and rephrased outputs is provided for clarity:
